name: Cedarwood Resort

reviews.title: Overpriced for quality
reviews.text: Sadly, I agree with the other recent posters...the Lodge at Jay was way overpriced for the room provided. We stayed in a two-level room that had 4 beds and while the space was adequate, the beds were clean and comfortable, a decent, newish TV...that is where the positives ended. The rooms were not thoroughly clean (hair in bathrooms, garbage under the beds, dozens of live ladybugs on the windowsills and worst of all, the water was terrible---undrinkable! It has iron or something in it that stains the toilet and tastes toxic. The breakfast was, as described by others, unprofessionally presented (I don't think the Health Dept. would approve) and not maintained thoughout the morning. We loved skiing at Jay (in this year of little natural snow in New England...they have it!!), but I would rent a trailside condo next time and not take a chance with another no-name motel.

reviews.title: The BIG dissapointment
reviews.text: Friendly staff. Lots of smiles and a laid back atmosphere. The Lodge is down the road from Jay Peak, around a 5 minute ride. It's situated beside the Country Store (worth a visit!) and across from the Jay Village Inn.

description: Cedarwood Resort, located in the village of Jay up on top of the hill, in the shadow of the "Peak". We just finished constructing "Peaks View", a 28 site full service Campground and now the renovation of the "The Bridge" Restaurant and "D'Cota's" Tavern downstairs, the property has undergone a remarkable change. All this under one new name, "Cedarwood Resort" ....It's all right here!
